property.name: Database Connectiecordson Pooling Service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database

property.name: SQL select query
property.description: The SQL select query to execute. The query can be empty, a constant value, or built from attributes using Expression Language. If this property is specified, it will be used regardless of the content of incoming flowfiles. If this property is empty, the content of the incoming flow file is expected to contain a valid SQL select query, to be issued by the processor to the database. Note that Expression Language is not evaluated for flow file contents.

property.name: Max Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.

property.name: esql-auto-commit
property.description: Enables or disables the auto commit functionality of the DB connection. Default value is 'true'. The default value can be used with most of the JDBC drivers and this functionality doesn't have any impact in most of the cases since this processor is used to read data. However, for some JDBC drivers such as PostgreSQL driver, it is required to disable the auto committing functionality to limit the number of result rows fetching at a time. When auto commit is enabled, postgreSQL driver loads whole result set to memory at once. This could lead for a large amount of memory usage when executing queries which fetch large data sets. More Details of this behaviour in PostgreSQL driver can be found in https://jdbc.postgresql.org//documentation/head/query.html.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Successfully created FlowFile from SQL query result set.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: SQL query execution failed. Incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.avro.ConvertAvroToJSON
extension.description: Converts a Binary Avro record into a JSON object. This processor provides a direct mapping of an Avro field to a JSON field, such that the resulting JSON will have the same hierarchical structure as the Avro document. Note that the Avro schema information will be lost, as this is not a translation from binary Avro to JSON formatted Avro. The output JSON is encoded the UTF-8 encoding. If an incoming FlowFile contains a stream of multiple Avro records, the resultant FlowFile will contain a JSON Array containing all of the Avro records or a sequence of JSON Objects. If an incoming FlowFile does not contain any records, an empty JSON object is the output. Empty/Single Avro record FlowFile inputs are optionally wrapped in a container as dictated by 'Wrap Single Record'

property.name: JSON container options
property.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).

property.name: Wrap Single Record
property.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'

property.name: Avro schema
property.description: If the Avro records do not contain the schema (datum only), it must be specified here.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the mime type to application/json

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.avro.ExtractAvroMetadata
extension.description: Extracts metadata from the header of an Avro datafile.

property.name: Fingerprint Algorithm
property.description: The algorithm used to generate the schema fingerprint. Available choices are based on the Avro recommended practices for fingerprint generation.

property.name: Metadata Keys
property.description: A comma-separated list of keys indicating key/value pairs to extract from the Avro file header. The key 'avro.schema' can be used to extract the full schema in JSON format, and 'avro.codec' can be used to extract the codec name if one exists.

property.name: Count Items
property.description: If true the number of items in the datafile will be counted and stored in a FlowFile attribute 'item.count'. The counting is done by reading blocks and getting the number of items for each block, thus avoiding de-serializing. The items being counted will be the top-level items in the datafile. For example, with a schema of type record the items will be the records, and for a schema of type Array the items will be the arrays (not the number of entries in each array).

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after metadata has been extracted.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or metadata cannot be extracted for any reason

writesAttribute.name: schema.type
writesAttribute.description: The type of the schema (i.e. record, enum, etc.).

writesAttribute.name: schema.name
writesAttribute.description: Contains the name when the type is a record, enum or fixed, otherwise contains the name of the primitive type.

writesAttribute.name: schema.fingerprint
writesAttribute.description: The result of the Fingerprint Algorithm as a Hex string.

writesAttribute.name: item.count
writesAttribute.description: The total number of items in the datafile, only written if Count Items is set to true.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.avro.SplitAvro
extension.description: Splits a binary encoded Avro datafile into smaller files based on the configured Output Size. The Output Strategy determines if the smaller files will be Avro datafiles, or bare Avro records with metadata in the FlowFile attributes. The output will always be binary encoded.

property.name: Split Strategy
property.description: The strategy for splitting the incoming datafile. The Record strategy will read the incoming datafile by de-serializing each record.

property.name: Output Size
property.description: The number of Avro records to include per split file. In cases where the incoming file has less records than the Output Size, or when the total number of records does not divide evenly by the Output Size, it is possible to get a split file with less records.

property.name: Output Strategy
property.description: Determines the format of the output. Either Avro Datafile, or bare record. Bare record output is only intended for use with systems that already require it, and shouldn't be needed for normal use.

property.name: Transfer Metadata
property.description: Whether or not to transfer metadata from the parent datafile to the children. If the Output Strategy is Bare Record, then the metadata will be stored as FlowFile attributes, otherwise it will be in the Datafile header.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid Avro), it will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The original FlowFile that was split. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship

relationship.name: split
relationship.description: All new files split from the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: fragment.identifier
writesAttribute.description: All split FlowFiles produced from the same parent FlowFile will have the same randomly generated UUID added for this attribute

writesAttribute.name: fragment.index
writesAttribute.description: A one-up number that indicates the ordering of the split FlowFiles that were created from a single parent FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: fragment.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of split FlowFiles generated from the parent FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: segment.original.filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename of the parent FlowFile

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.dbcp.DBCPConnectionPool
extension.description: Provides Database Connection Pooling Service. Connections can be asked from pool and returned after usage.

property.name: Database Connection URL
property.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.

property.name: Database Driver Class Name
property.description: Database driver class name

property.name: database-driver-locations
property.description: Comma-separated list of files/folders and/or URLs containing the driver JAR and its dependencies (if any). For example '/var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'

property.name: kerberos-user-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos User Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: kerberos-credentials-service
property.description: Specifies the Kerberos Credentials Controller Service that should be used for authenticating with Kerberos

property.name: kerberos-principal
property.description: The principal to use when specifying the principal and password directly in the processor for authenticating via Kerberos.

property.name: kerberos-password
property.description: The password to use when specifying the principal and password directly in the processor for authenticating via Kerberos.

property.name: Database User
property.description: Database user name

property.name: Password
property.description: The password for the database user

property.name: Max Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or -1 to wait indefinitely.

property.name: Max Total Connections
property.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.

property.name: Validation-query
property.description: Validation query used to validate connections before returning them. When connection is invalid, it gets dropped and new valid connection will be returned. Note!! Using validation might have some performance penalty.

property.name: dbcp-min-idle-conns
property.description: The minimum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool without extra ones being created. Set to or zero to allow no idle connections.

property.name: dbcp-max-idle-conns
property.description: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool without extra ones being released. Set to any negative value to allow unlimited idle connections.

property.name: dbcp-max-conn-lifetime
property.description: The maximum lifetime in milliseconds of a connection. After this time is exceeded the connection will fail the next activation, passivation or validation test. A value of zero or less means the connection has an infinite lifetime.

property.name: dbcp-time-between-eviction-runs
property.description: The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle connection evictor thread. When non-positive, no idle connection evictor thread will be run.

property.name: dbcp-min-evictable-idle-time
property.description: The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction.

property.name: dbcp-soft-min-evictable-idle-time
property.description: The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle connection evictor, with the extra condition that at least a minimum number of idle connections remain in the pool. When the not-soft version of this option is set to a positive value, it is examined first by the idle connection evictor: when idle connections are visited by the evictor, idle time is first compared against it (without considering the number of idle connections in the pool) and then against this soft option, including the minimum idle connections constraint.

dynamicProperty.name: JDBC property name
dynamicProperty.description: JDBC driver property name and value applied to JDBC connections.

dynamicProperty.name: SENSITIVE.JDBC property name
dynamicProperty.description: JDBC driver property name prefixed with 'SENSITIVE.' handled as a sensitive property.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.dbcp.DBCPConnectionPoolLookup
extension.description: Provides a DBCPService that can be used to dynamically select another DBCPService. This service requires an attribute named 'database.name' to be passed in when asking for a connection, and will throw an exception if the attribute is missing. The value of 'database.name' will be used to select the DBCPService that has been registered with that name. This will allow multiple DBCPServices to be defined and registered, and then selected dynamically at runtime by tagging flow files with the appropriate 'database.name' attribute.

dynamicProperty.name: The name to register DBCPService
dynamicProperty.description: If 'database.name' attribute contains the name of the dynamic property, then the DBCPService (registered in the value) will be selected.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.record.sink.db.DatabaseRecordSink
extension.description: Provides a service to write records using a configured database connection.

property.name: db-record-sink-dcbp-service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain a connection to the database for sending records.

property.name: db-record-sink-catalog-name
property.description: The name of the catalog that the statement should update. This may not apply for the database that you are updating. In this case, leave the field empty

property.name: db-record-sink-schema-name
property.description: The name of the schema that the table belongs to. This may not apply for the database that you are updating. In this case, leave the field empty

property.name: db-record-sink-table-name
property.description: The name of the table that the statement should affect.

property.name: db-record-sink-translate-field-names
property.description: If true, the Processor will attempt to translate field names into the appropriate column names for the table specified. If false, the field names must match the column names exactly, or the column will not be updated

property.name: db-record-sink-unmatched-field-behavior
property.description: If an incoming record has a field that does not map to any of the database table's columns, this property specifies how to handle the situation

allowableValue.description: Any field in the document that cannot be mapped to a column in the database is ignored
If the document has any field that cannot be mapped to a column in the database, the FlowFile will be routed to the failure relationship

property.name: db-record-sink-unmatched-column-behavior
property.description: If an incoming record does not have a field mapping for all of the database table's columns, this property specifies how to handle the situation

allowableValue.description: Any column in the database that does not have a field in the document will be assumed to not be required. No notification will be logged
Any column in the database that does not have a field in the document will be assumed to not be required. A warning will be logged
A flow will fail if any column in the database that does not have a field in the document. An error will be logged

property.name: db-record-sink-quoted-identifiers
property.description: Enabling this option will cause all column names to be quoted, allowing you to use reserved words as column names in your tables.

property.name: db-record-sink-quoted-table-identifiers
property.description: Enabling this option will cause the table name to be quoted to support the use of special characters in the table name.

property.name: db-record-sink-query-timeout
property.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL statement , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
